title: Israel plans to seize major archaeological site in the West Bank
description: The move coincided with the establishment of a new illegal outpost by Israeli settlers near Bethlehem and comes as the Israeli government faces growing pressure to crackdown on settler violence.

title: Archaeologists discover 'ancient monument' on farm
description: Evidence of a 4,500-year-old burial site was found on the land in Wigan after painstaking excavations.

title: ‘They can’t build next to the birthplace of Roman Britain’
description: A plan for a huge solar farm development just 160 metres from a site described as the birthplace of Roman Britain is set to be decided next week.

title: The first kiss? Scientists push origin of kissing to ancient African apes 21 million years ago
description: New research suggests the first kiss occurred 16.9-21.5 million years ago between ape ancestors in Africa. Scientists analyzed primate behavior, concluding kissing predates humans and likely occurred between Neanderthals and Homo Sapiens, evidenced by shared oral microbes.

title: Turkmenistan Delegation Visits Leading Cultural and Scientific Centers in Paris
description: As part of an official visit to the French Republic, a Turkmen delegation on 17–18 November toured two landmark institutions in the French capital: the Musée de l’Homme and the Institut du monde arabe. On 17 November, the delegation visited the Musée de l’Homme.
